questions.question: A poset or partially ordered set A is a pair, ( B,≤ ) of a set B whose elements are called the vertices of A and obeys following rules
___ elements of A are those where a ≤ c in A does not contain elements in c

explanations.a: Maximal elemets of A are those where a ≤ c in A does not contain elements in c
explanations.b: Maximal elemets of A are those where a ≤ c in A does not contain elements in c
explanations.c: Maximal elemets of A are those where a ≤ c in A does not contain elements in c
explanations.d: Maximal elemets of A are those where a ≤ c in A does not contain elements in c

questions.question: Let A={1,2,3,4,6,24,36,72}, Let ≤ be the partial order defined by A≤B if a divides b. Number of edges in the Hasse diagram of (A,≤) is

explanations.a: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11
explanations.b: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11
explanations.c: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11
explanations.d: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11

questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18], then number of edges in the poset diagram of poset [A; /] is
Let P be the set of all people. Let R be a binary relation on P such that (a, b) is in R if a is a brother of b. Is R symmetric, transitive, an equivalence relation, a partial order relation?

explanations.d: R is Transitive not equivalence relation
